sn56.55:4.1: “Mendicants, suppose a person was to place seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds on the great earth.
sn56.55:4.2: What do you think, mendicants? Which is more: the seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds, or the great earth?”
sn56.55:4.4: “Sir, the great earth is certainly more.
sn56.55:4.6: The seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds are tiny.
sn56.55:4.7: Compared to the great earth, they can’t be reckoned or compared, they’re not even a fraction.”
sn56.55:4.8: “In the same way, for a noble disciple …
sn56.55:4.9: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
